sectiondef.header: Variadic redirectors for \link QUICK_FUNCTION() QUICK_FUNCTION\endlink function.

detaileddescription.para: Quick, one-line declaration of simple module functions, including dependencies. Allows declaration of capability, function name and type, dependencies and up to ten allowed models, all in one hit. Typically used to supplement standalone modules so that all dependencies can be dealt with, but can be used in rollcall headers as well. NEW_CAPABILITY_FLAG can be either NEW_CAPABILITY or OLD_CAPABILITY. {@

description.para: Registers the current FUNCTION of the current MODULE as a provider of the current CAPABILITY, returning a result of type TYPE. Allows this function to manage loops if the optional second argument CAN_MANAGE_LOOPS is given; otherwise, if CANNOT_MANAGE_LOOPS is given instead, or no second argument is given, the function is prohibited from managing loops.

memberdef.name: START_FUNCTION_
memberdef.initializer: FAIL("Unrecognised flag in argument 2 of START_FUNCTION; should be "\ "CAN_MANAGE_LOOPS, CANNOT_MANAGE_LOOPS, INIT_FUNCTION, or absent.")

sectiondef.header: Variadic redirection macro for BACKEND_REQ_FROM_GROUP(GROUP, CAPABILITY, (TAGS), TYPE, [(ARGS)])
Variadic redirection macro for BACKEND_REQ(CAPABILITY, (TAGS), TYPE, [(ARGS)])

detaileddescription.para: Specifies that the current FUNCTION in ExampleBit_B (this MODULE) requires BACKEND_REQ from a backend code. The requirement BACKEND_REQ corresponds to a capability that a valid backend function is expected to report in its corresponding registration header file.

sectiondef.header: Variadic redirection macro for LONG_BACKEND_REQ(CAPABILITY, (TAGS), TYPE, [(ARGS)])

briefdescription.para: NEEDS_CLASSES_FROM() called with no versions; use default.
CLASSLOAD_NEEDED() called with one or more versions; require specified backend versions.

detaileddescription.para: Redirects the NEEDS_CLASSES_FROM(BACKEND, [VERSIONS]) macro to the CLASSLOAD_NEEDED(BACKEND, VERSTRING) macro according to whether it has been called with version numbers or not (making the version number 'default' if it is omitted).
Shortcuts for allowing declarations of joint models (single-line model combinations)

description.para: Register that the current FUNCTION may only be used with the listed models. The current maximum number of models that can be indicated this way is 10; if more models should be allowed, ALLOW_MODELS can be called multiple times. If ALLOW_MODELS and ALLOW_MODEL_COMBINATION are both absent, all models are considered to be allowed.

memberdef.name: ALLOW_MODELS_10
memberdef.initializer: ALLOWED_MODEL(A,B,_1) ALLOWED_MODEL(A,B,_2) ALLOWED_MODEL(A,B,_3) \ ALLOWED_MODEL(A,B,_4) ALLOWED_MODEL(A,B,_5) ALLOWED_MODEL(A,B,_6) \ ALLOWED_MODEL(A,B,_7) ALLOWED_MODEL(A,B,_8) ALLOWED_MODEL(A,B,_9) \ ALLOWED_MODEL(A,B,_10)

description.para: Register that the current FUNCTION may only be used with the listed models, but only in certain combinations. The current maximum number of models that can be indicated this way is 10; if more models should be allowed, ALLOW_MODEL_DEPENDENCE can be called multiple times. If ALLOW_MODELS and ALLOW_MODEL_COMBINATION are both absent, all models are considered to be allowed.

description.para: Declare one or more backend GROUPS, from each of which one constituent backend requirement must be fulfilled.

sectiondef.header: Variadic redirection macros for ACTIVATE_FOR_BACKEND(BACKEND_REQ, BACKEND, [VERSIONS])

description.para: Indicate that the current CONDITIONAL_DEPENDENCY should be activated if the backend requirement BACKEND_REQ of the current FUNCTION is filled by a backend function from BACKEND. The specific versions that this applies to are passed as optional additional arguments; if no version information is passed, all versions of BACKEND are considered to cause the CONDITIONAL_DEPENDENCY to become active.

briefdescription.para: ACTIVATE_FOR_BACKEND() called with no versions; allow any backend version.
ACTIVATE_FOR_BACKEND() called with two arguments; allow specified backend versions.

detaileddescription.para: Redirects the ACTIVATE_FOR_BACKEND(BACKEND_REQ, BACKEND, [VERSIONS]) macro to the ACTIVATE_DEP_BE(BACKEND_REQ, BACKEND, VERSTRING) macro according to whether it has been called with version numbers or not (making the version number 'any' if it is omitted).

briefdescription.para: Define a macro to suppress unused variable and typedef warnings in GCC (and do nothing for other compilers)

detaileddescription.para: Generic observable and likelihood function module rollcall macro definitions, common to both the core and actual module source code.
Authors (add name and date if you modify):
